examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
Using the camera was as easy as pie.
It's an easy exam.
words.defineEn: needing little skill or effort to do or understand
words.defineVi: cần ít kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm hoặc hiểu

examples: Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
A large crowd watched the game on Saturday.
He left a large estate.
A large bus was sitting outside.
The truck delivered a large shipment of goods to the warehouse.
words.defineEn: big or above average in amount or size
words.defineVi: lớn hoặc trên trung bình về số lượng hoặc kích thước

examples: "The discussion is closed."
The closed window blocked out the noise from the street.
The closed lid of the jar preserved the freshness of the food inside.
The meeting was held behind closed doors.
She received a closed envelope containing a surprise gift.
words.defineEn: not letting things, people, etc. go in or out
words.defineVi: không cho đồ vật, người, v.v. ra vào

examples: May your wildest dreams come true!
A true leader walks the talk.
The true story inspired many people around the world.
Calamity is man's true touchstone.
Her true feelings were finally out in the open.
words.defineEn: according to reality or facts
words.defineVi: theo thực tế hoặc sự kiện

examples: Everything was free
The museum has free admission on Fridays.
Nothing in life is free, no penny, no paternoster.
The press as always gave him a free pass as with so many other issues.
The country is holding its first free elections for 20 years.
words.defineEn: not requiring payment
words.defineVi: không yêu cầu thanh toán

examples: The open window let in a cool breeze.
I dipped my feet in the cool water of the river.
I'd give my right arm for a nice cool drink.
She pressed her cheek against the cool glass window.
He completely lost his cool and started yelling.
words.defineEn: having a temperature that is low but not cold, especially in a way that is enjoyable and pleasant
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ thấp nhưng không lạnh, đặc biệt là theo cách thú vị và dễ chịu

examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
The orchard's yield of apples was lower this year due to unfavorable weather conditions.
The euro hit a record low in trading today.
Watch your head on the low ceiling.
The country was at a low ebb due to the recent war
words.defineEn: not far above the ground or having a small upward extension
words.defineVi: không xa mặt đất hoặc có phần mở rộng hướng lên nhỏ

examples: You raise some interesting points.
We had a very interesting discussion about climate change.
It's an interesting proposal.
All of them had an interesting story to tell.
The game's premise and mechanics are interesting, but there's just no meat on the bone when it comes to story and gameplay variety.
words.defineEn: catching and keeping our attention because of being unusual, exciting, etc.
words.defineVi: thu hút và giữ sự chú ý của chúng tôi vì khác thường, thú vị, v.v.

examples: Her grandmother's garden was full of stone fruit trees.
I take full responsibility for my actions.
Many schools don’t take full advantage of the Internet.
See full dictionary entry for heart.
The school took the full force of the explosion.
words.defineEn: having no space left
words.defineVi: không còn chỗ trống

examples: I'll be ready in a minute.
I'm ready to start the process of writing.
I'm ready to drop!
The cookie dough is ready to be rolled into small balls and baked.
He's always ready to help at the drop of a dime.
words.defineEn: mentally or physically prepared for a situation or activity
words.defineVi: chuẩn bị tinh thần hoặc thể chất cho một tình huống hoặc hoạt động

examples: The local bus company only runs a skeleton service on Sundays.
Your arrogance only adds fuel to the fire Manfred.
The HR department only shared the employee's personal information on a need-to-know basis.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
The carpet only reached halfway across the room.
words.defineEn: not another thing or person existing in the same category
words.defineVi: không phải là một thứ khác hoặc người tồn tại trong cùng một loại

examples: The best professional musicians start young.
The young actress received an award for her outstanding performance.
Those young people have some guts.
That young woman was close as an oyster!
The young man was a twenty-one-year-old college student.
words.defineEn: still in the earlier stages of life
words.defineVi: vẫn còn trong giai đoạn đầu của cuộc sống

examples: Certain species of fucoid algae serve as habitats for small marine creatures.
As with all diseases, certain groups will be more at risk than others.
The store sometimes offers discounts on certain items.
The distinct taste and texture of kelp are appreciated in certain cuisines around the world.
Certain species of dinoflagellates can create red tides, affecting marine life.
words.defineEn: feeling completely sure about something and showing that you believe it
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoàn toàn chắc chắn về điều gì đó và thể hiện rằng bạn tin vào điều đó

examples: Such helps were like drop in the ocean.
Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.
Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
There is no such thing as a free lunch.
There’s no such thing as a free lunch.
words.defineEn: used to emphasize the remarkable degree or quality of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh mức độ đáng chú ý hoặc chất lượng của một cái gì đó

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: The night sky is black, except for the stars and the moon.
The company is finally in the black.
Each 180-litre container will hold up to three black bags of rubbish.
Each 180-litre container will hold up to three black bags of rubbish.
She prefers her coffee black, without any sugar or cream.
words.defineEn: having the color that is the darkest, like most crows
words.defineVi: có màu tối nhất, giống như hầu hết các loài quạ

examples: I was enjoying every single cut of marinated chicken, beef, and pork.
The ticket for the bus is valid for a single journey.
My siblings and I share a single bedroom in our house.
Some of the people don't deserve a single red cent.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
words.defineEn: no more than one in number
words.defineVi: không nhiều hơn một trong số

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling good
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tốt

examples: For Anne, the call of duty was strong.
The strong winds knocked down several trees on the road.
The manager played his strongest side of the season.
Many people are led astray by strong feelings
Patience isn't exactly her strong suit.
words.defineEn: having great strength or a lot of physical power
words.defineVi: có sức mạnh tuyệt vời hoặc rất nhiều sức mạnh thể chất

examples: In his mother’s eyes, the boy can do no wrong.
The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.
I accidentally hit the wrong key.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
She pressed the wrong button and accidentally deleted the file.
words.defineEn: not based on facts or the truth
words.defineVi: không dựa trên sự thật hay sự thật

examples: Cable TV reaches a huge audience.
Two huge fountains were playing outside the entrance.
She was given a huge bunch of flowers.
The company's latest advertising campaign was a huge success, hitting it out of the park with record-breaking sales and customer engagement.
A huge white elephant of a house that needed ten thousand spent on it.
words.defineEn: very large in size, or great in degree or amount
words.defineVi: rất lớn về kích thước, hoặc lớn về mức độ hoặc số lượng

examples: The paneer curry smells amazing!
It’s amazing.
My mom is an amazing cook.
It is amazing really.
That's amazing Ralph.
words.defineEn: extremely surprising, particularly in a good way
words.defineVi: cực kỳ ngạc nhiên, đặc biệt là trong một cách tốt

examples: The poem uses simple language.
He prepared a simple sandwich with sliced luncheon meat, lettuce, and mayo for his quick lunch.
He prepared a simple salad with iceberg lettuce.
Simple childhood memories have a way of clearing the cobwebs away.
The girl's simple words had been ringing the death-knell of his expectations.
words.defineEn: not involving difficulty in doing or understanding
words.defineVi: không liên quan đến khó khăn trong việc làm hoặc hiểu

examples: Take enough supplies.
Alright I had enough.
Are you warm enough?
Oh yes, enough said.
Even a dog knows enough to come out of the rain, Charlie.
words.defineEn: as much as is required
words.defineVi: nhiều như được yêu cầu
